Campus

CAMPUS HIRING

Campus Hiring-

Each year, we invite our industry partners and other reputed organizations to the college campus to participate in the placement process for both Undergraduate and Postgraduate programmes. We connect to invited companies, discuss their requirements and mutually agree on a tentative date for doing the placement drive. We also connect to all students, collate the student data, get their registrations for placements and brief them the placement policy and rules before the placement season starts for all the final year students.

We follow the below placement process for smooth running of placement drives and the post selection steps of offer acceptance, pre-joining formalities and the candidate joining process:

    1. Company Requirements and Details: Companies share job requirements, position descriptions, eligibility criteria, salary details, and company introduction.
    2. Publishing on Internal Portal: The company details and requirements are published on the college’s internal portal for students to view.
    3. Student Registration: Eligible and interested students register for the job opportunities through the portal.
    4. Data Sharing with Companies: A list of eligible students, including their details (degree/department, date of birth, prior education marks, current CGPA, backlogs, etc.), is shared with the company.
    5. Shortlisting by Companies: Companies review the student data, shortlist candidates (if necessary), and send the final list of selected students prior to the placement drive date.
    6. Pre-Placement Talk: On the placement drive date, companies conduct pre-placement talks, providing job overviews, compensation, expectations, and answering students’ questions.
    7. Selection Process: Companies typically conduct Written Tests, Group Discussions, Case Studies, and Personal Interviews.
    8. Announcement of Selections: Most companies announce the selected students by the end of the day on the drive date, followed by a confirmation email from the company’s HR team.
    9. Offer Letter Process: Companies send formal offer letters to individual students with a copy to the placement department.
    10. Post-Offer Activities: The placement department connects with students and follows through the acceptance process and any other post-offer activities like document submissions, briefing sessions, training, internships, etc.
    11. Final Follow-Through: The placement department remains connected with students and companies until all students complete the post-offer formalities and join the organization.
